comment._content: A debutante, see The Washington times., October 13, 1915, HOME EDITION, Page 11, with photo

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Think this might be her--age is right on, and the Washington setting also matches. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=64936004 A letter by Dorothy Dennett Slemp to Congresswoman Alice Robertson, written from Cincinnati 1928: www.lib.utulsa.edu/digital/robertson/Series_II/transcript... Her father was General Commissioner of the Land Office: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=29881973 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Dennett I'm going to take a guess that the Rev. Dennett Slemp of Virginia is her son: www.youtube.com/watch?v=sz4eMCs8vJQ&feature=share&amp...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59 and pennylrichardsca: Thanks for the visual confirmation as well as the further details about her life post-debutante! We will add a few more details to the catalog record.
